div.sent: Justice and truth lead to happiness and peace.
There cannot be any peace or happiness without justice and truth.
God wants that all men attain happiness and prosperity in.
their personal, family, social and civic life by pursuing justice and truth.
Sin and evil are the root cause of all misery and unhappiness.
Human beings commit sins when they go astray and do evil by giving into vices such as greed, anger, envy, idleness, stealing and injustice.
This is how his mind, conscience and even his body get vitiated.
And as a result he brings down evil and unhappiness on himself and others.
A man's soul is contaminated by sins and injustice.
Therefore, man has to protect his body and soul from the stain of sin and evil.
Young students should be obedient and listen to their parents, religious leaders, teachers and respected elders.
They should avoid being arrogant, give up bad habits and bad companions, and shun bad advice and bad thoughts.
But human beings are weak by nature.
They fall into sin and go astray when they give into such vices as greed, envy, pride, anger, revenge, disobedience, etc.
For this reason God sent prophets and teachers many times in the past to call men back to the path of justice and truth.
We should remember this advice: Righteousness is the road to life; wickedness is the road to death.
No one can please God by being unjust and by lying, nor can anyone find peace in this way.
Only by being honest and doing good deeds that we can find happiness for ourselves and for others.
We can glorify God by leading honest and good life.
Such a life is also a kind of preaching of the Word of God.
We can make people understand that our God is a God of truth and justice and we are His true disciples.
In the teachings of the Prophets and of Jesus we find this call to justice and truth again and again.
In the New Testament, one of such great men was John the Baptist.
He was an ascetic and a great prophet chosen by God.
It is about him that in the Bible it is written : Someone is shouting in the desert,`Prepare a road for the Lord!
Clear the way in the desert for our God.
In the Old Testament, Prophet Isaiah had foretold the coming of John the Baptist.
And his prophecy came true.
John the Baptist was the son of Zechariah, a priest of the Jews.
John's mother's name was Elizabeth.
John came to prepare the way for the coming of Jesus Christ.
Hence he is called the `herald of Jesus.
For he announced to the Israelites the coming of Jesus the Messiah.
His call was to conversion to the path of justice and truth.
John the Baptist led a very austere life.
His clothes were made of camel's hair; he wore a leather belt round his waist, and his food was locusts and wild honey.
He went around in the wilderness, meditating on God and praying.
He was chosen by God as the forerunner of Jesus Christ.
He uttered his prophetic message in a loud voice, calling men to conversion.
In the wilderness of Judea, John told the people who gathered around him, You brood of vipers !
Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come ?
About the false prophets and the hypocrites John said to the people, By their works you will come to know them.
For figs are not gathered from thorns, nor are grapes-picked from a bramble bush.
A good tree bears good fruit, and a bad tree bears bad fruit.
In the same way, you will be known by your works.
The axe is ready to cut down the trees at the roots.
Every tree that does not bear good fruit will be cut down and thrown in the fire.
He began to preach the baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins by the side of the River Jordan;
multitude came from Jerusalem and Judea to be baptized by him.
Many were touched by his preaching and they repented for their sins.
They confessed their sins publicly and were baptized by John in the Jordan.
John replied, No, I am not Elijah, nor am I the Messiah.
Jesus the expected Saviour is coming after me.
I am not worthy to untie the thong of his sandals.
I baptize you with water; but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit:
The multitude, that gathered again asked him, What then shall we do?
He answered, Repent and be converted.
Be honest and truthful.
He who has two coats, let him share with him who has none; and he who has food, let him, do likewise.
To the tax collectors he said, Collect no more than is appointed you.
Soldiers asked him, And we, what shall we do?
John answered, Rob no one by violence or by false accusation, and be content with your wages.
Let the rulers rule with justice.
With many such words John preached the word of God to the people.
Why did God create us?
He created us to know him, to love him and serve him.
He created us to live justly and honestly and to attain eternal life hereafter.
Therefore, we should be holy and keep our soul pure.
While making efforts to achieve our own progress and well-being, we should also try to help others to attain the same.
We should avoid sin and injustice, and we should live good and holy lives.
We have to overcome greed;
envy, pride and spirit of revenge and avoid harmful acts;
we should practice piety and self-control.
We should repent for our sins and live according to the teachings of Jesus.
We have to be formed well to work for the good of the country and the people.
We have to give up bad habits and overcome idleness.
We have to learn to be polite, courteous, humble and-industrious.
We should practise such virtues and qualities as truthfulness, obedience, discipline, justice and doing good to others.
And in this way develop our moral and spiritual life.
Lord Jesus, help me to live a good and honest life.
Help me always to avoid bad thoughts, harmful acts, bad companions and wrong advice.
Help me to live according to your teachings, being obedient to my respected elders and obeying their orders.
Lord, let me not neglect my duties and lose any opportunity to help others.
Lord Jesus, stay with me.
This I pray iii your holy name.
Out of love God created man and he created him in his own image.
For their own happiness, he had kept them in a Garden called Eden.
Even then they disobeyed God.
They fell into temptation.
They were not able to overcome their greed and ambition.
They fell into sin by disobeying God.
As a punishment for their sins, man was driven to this earth.
But God loved them so much that he promised to send them a Saviour who would redeem them from their sins.
All through the ages God planned to save mankind from their sins by sending many prophets.
But even the Chosen People of God did not fulfill God's commandments.
The other nations too forgot God and committed sins.
So there was a need to send a Saviour who would lead men back to the right path.
In the previous lesson we learned that God sent John the Baptist as the forerunner of the Messiah to prepare his way.
John the Baptist was called `Herald of Jesus because he came before him to prepare his way.
Isnt it so?
In the following lesson we will learn about the birth of Jesus Christ, the Saviour.
The northern region of Palestine is known as Galilee.
A young girl named Mary used to live in Nazareth which was in this region.
Mary's father name was Joachim and her mother's name was Anna.
Elizabeth, the mother of John the Baptist, was Mary's cousin.
Mary was a very saintly woman.
She never committed any sins.
Because she was to be the mother of our Saviour Jesus Christ, by God's special grace she was free from sin from her birth.
Her soul was as pure as an angel.
By virtue of her holiness, meekness and truthfulness she was uniquely favoured by God as his chosen and beloved one.
The Angel of the Lord appeared to Mary and said, Hail, Full of grace !
Peace be with you.
The Lord has greatly blessed you.
Mary was deeply troubled by the angel's message.
For she was very meek and humble.
She could not understand whey the angel uttered such words of praise.
Therefore she was afraid.
The angel reassured her saying, Don't be afraid, Mary; God has been gracious to you.
You will become pregnant and give birth to a son, and you will name him Jesus, which means Saviour.
He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High God.
The Lord God will give him a king, as his ancestor David was.
His kingdom will never end.
Mary was a virgin.
So she said to the angel, I am a virgin.
How, then, can this be ?
Angel Gabriel answered, The Holy spirit will rest upon you, and God's power will rest upon you.
For this reason the holy child will be called the son of God.
Remember your relative Elizabeth.
It is said that she cannot have children, but she herself is now six months pregnant, even though she is very old.
For there is nothing that God cannot do.
Mary then understood that it was God who sent Angel Gabriel to her.
So she humbly said to the angel, I am the Lord's servant.
May it happen to me as you have said.
God now fulfilled what he had promised to mankind long ago.
Two thousand years ago, Our Lord Jesus Christ was born in a stable in the city of Bethlehem in Palestine.
The inhabitants of Palestine were called the Israelites or the Jews.
The Romans were occupying the land and they were ruling Palestine through their own Governor and army.
Emperor Augustus Caesar ordered a census to be taken throughout the Roman Empire.
When this first census took place, Quirinius was the governor of Syria.
Everyone, then, went to register himself, each to his own town where their ancestors had lived.
Joseph and Mary left Nazareth which is situated in the northern region of Palestine and went to Bethlehem to register their names.
For they were descendants of David, and Bethlehem was the city of David.
After the registration was done, Joseph and Mary could not return home.
But they could not find a place to stay either.
For many people had come to Bethlehem to register their names.
All the hotels and the inns were filled with guests.
No one welcomed them into their private homes.
Finally they took shelter in a stable.
It was late night; Mary gave birth to her son in this stable in Bethlehem.
Finding no place to lay the child, Mary wrapped the baby in strips of cloth and laid in a manger.
In this way the prophecy made by Isaiah was fulfilled : A child is born to us !
A son is given to us!
And he will be our ruler.
See, how much God loves mankind.
Because of their disobedience God had thrown out Adam and Eve from the Garden of Eden.
But he had promised to send a Saviour to redeem mankind.
When they continued to sin again and again, God sent the prophets to call them to conversion.
Finally he sent John the Baptist to prepare the way for the Lord's coming.
But John too was killed by them.
Yet God kept his promises and sent his only son among us to show us the way of salvation.
We hear this spoken to us repeatedly; should we not heed this message ?
In a spirit of humility and simplicity she obeyed God and cooperated with God's plan of salvation.
Therefore, she is our mother too.
Think of how deep was the love of God the Son for man that he assumed human nature and came among us.
He had no craving for power and wealth.
He came as a man to save mankind from their sins and lead them to the Kingdom of God.
By born in a stable out of love, he showed us how much he loved the poor.
God has assigned a definite task to each one of us.
We must fulfill that task cheerfully.
The first duty of the children is to obey God and their parents, respected elders and teachers, and pay attention to their studies.
Besides, they should maintain good relationship with their neighbours, playmates and fellow students, and help them in their needs.
This too is a part of their obedience to God.
We must also become good citizens and abide by the laws of the State as Joseph and Mary did.
Disobedience to the laws of the State creates disturbance and chaos.
We must be meek and humble in everything we do at home, in school and in the society.
Our Lord Jesus Christ, Mary and Joseph always did that.
If we follow the example of Jesus, family in our personal, family and social life, then there will be peace, harmony and prosperity.
We must obey God and walk humbly before him.
Humility is a great virtue which teaches us to lead our lives faithfully.
We have to obey the laws of the State.
We have to accept our poverty cheerfully.
In all trials and difficulties we have to strive for holiness and moral integrity.
We know that Adam and Eve were created sinless.
They were placed in the Garden of Eden in a state of holiness.
But they committed sins by disobeying God's commandments.
So God punished them by sending them to this earth.
The seed of the original Sin of our parents exists in all men and women.
Hence we are all sinners and as we go our way on earth we commit sins in many ways.
We are all sinners, we too commit many sins.
Man's soul is polluted by sin and he becomes unworthy to go to heaven; and he deserves punishment in hell.
On account of his sins and evil deeds, man brings about unhappiness for himself and for others.
As a result there is chaos in the society.
It is sin that creates disturbance and gives rise to conflicts, unrest and killings.
We see this situation of unrest and sinful conditions between nations and peoples since the fall of man into sin at the beginning of creation.
God wants all men to be liberated from sin and their souls cleansed of all sins.
He want very human being to go to heaven.
But human beings are weak; they fall into sin and thus become unworthy to go to heaven.
God, sent the prophets to the world to warn people against sins.
We find many such examples in the Old and the New Testaments.
But people did not pay any attention, to their teaching, advice and directions.
God loves man so much that he wants everyone to be converted from their sins and return to the right path.
God sent his own Son Jesus Christ to show the way of salvation to all men.
Jesus Christ received power from God the Father.
He is both God and Man.
Christ came to this world as a Man.
While on earth, he worked many miracles to heal men of their physical, mental and spiritual illnesses.
His greatest miracle was forgiving sinners.
Only God has the authority to forgive sins.
Jesus Christ is both God and Man at the same time.
Even as Man he possess divine power.
He is more powerful than the saints and the prophets.
This is the Christ we all believe in.
The Bible teaches clearly that Jesus alone forgives sins.
Now let us learn about this: Jesus is God's Son, and hence even as Man he forgives our sins.
He is our Lord and Saviour.
He worked far greater miracles than healing bodily illnesses : He forgave men's sins.
There are many examples of this in the Bible.
One day Jesus was preaching in his own hometown.
The crowd of people around him so large that there was no room to move.
A man who was paralysed and lying on a bed was brought by his relatives.
They were trying their best to enter the room but did not succeed.
Seeing their faith, Jesus said to the paralytic, Courage, my son !
Your sins are forgiven.
Then some of the teachers of the Law said to themselves, This man is speaking blasphemy!
Jesus perceived what they were thinking, so he said, Why are you thinking such evil things ?
Is it easier to say, `Your sins are forgiven,.
or to say, `Get up and walk ?
I will prove to you, then, that the son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.
So he said to the paralysed man, Get up, pick up your bed, and go home.
The man got up and.
went home rejoicing.
When the people saw such a miracle, they were afraid, and praised God for giving such authority to men.
One day a Pharisee invited Jesus to his house.
There Jesus forgave the sins of a woman who repented.
You can know about it from Luke 7: 36 -50.
So, you can see that Jesus had divine authority; he is the God who forgives man's sins.
The teachers of the Law and the religious fanatics pretended not to understand it.
But those who put their faith in him and asked for this help were cured, and their sins were forgiven.
Jesus was God, but he became man in order to save mankind.
It is amazing to see how much he loved the poor, the suffering and the sick.
Those who came to him and believed in him, received his mercy.
He forgave the sins of great public sinners;
he healed many who were sick, suffering and possessed by demons;
he raised the dead to life.
Whenever we humble ourselves and ask for forgiveness, he forgives us our sins.
When we are in great distress and pray to him, he grants us his help.
For making confession and obtaining forgiveness of sins, we need to examine our conscience without hiding anything.
Then we have to make a resolution not to commit any more sins and with true repentance make confession and ask for forgiveness.
Then God will forgive us our sins.
Humbly we have to ask for forgiveness for our sins and avoid the occasions of sin.
We have to ask for forgiveness, not only for ourselves, but for all the people of the world.
We have to help others in their needs as much as we can.
